summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and others regarding the technical loading of subpoenaed documents from the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner into the Relativity e-discovery platform for the case US v. Epstein. It details folder structures and file exclusions for two productions from the law firm.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of several emails in the chain, coordinating the upload of subpoenaed documents from Boies Schiller Flexner to the Relativity platform for the US v. Epstein case.

events.title: Boies Schiller First Subpoena Response
events.description: The law firm Boies Schiller Flexner produces documents in response to a subpoena from the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Boies Schiller Second Subpoena Response
events.description: Boies Schiller Flexner provides a second, follow-up production of documents in response to the SDNY subpoena.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain about loading evidence into an e-discovery system for the US v. Epstein case (docket 2018R01618).
It references two separate document productions from the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner in response to SDNY subpoenas, dated March 4 and April 18, 2019.
The emails specify technical details for organizing the documents in the Relativity platform, including creating folders for 'Subpoena Returns' and 'BSF returns'.

The correspondence instructs the exclusion of specific files from upload, including DVD file structures and video files from interviews with individuals identified only by initials (e.g., H.R., J.H., S.V., A.D., A.T.).
The primary correspondent is an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, indicating active prosecution work on the case in early 2019.
